item.title: Solving a partnership restructuring problem with linear algebra.
item.description: Solving a partnership restructuring problem with linear algebra. If you’d like to skip straight to the code, jump ahead to the end. Let’s consider a partnership that is restructuring its assets, with N partners and M assets. The partners currently share the business at differing shares, for example, partner N1 owns 33% of the company, partner N2 owns 20%, and so on. Each of the M assets carries a current value and a debt owed.
